motion_summary: The alarm clock remains largely in the center of the frame across all three images, with minor shifts in its position being negligible. The arrangement of the US Dollar bills shifts slightly between frames, indicating subtle movement or re-arrangement of the underlying currency. The clock hands advance, signifying the passage of time.
summary_text: The sequence of frames presents a static scene of an alarm clock placed atop a collection of US Dollar bills. Across the three frames, the alarm clock's hands advance, signifying the passage of time, while the underlying currency arrangement undergoes minor shifts. This visual narrative directly conveys the idiom 'time is money,' suggesting that time itself has monetary value and that its progression is intrinsically linked to financial considerations.
